Documentation for the Code¶

Custom Implementation of IBM Model 1¶

expectation_maximization.create_alignment_prob_dict(parallel_corpus, foreign_name='fr')[source]¶

This function will keep a state table for all the probabilities inside of alignment within a parallel sentence.

Alignment Dict Structure: {

sentence 1: alignment frame sentence 2: alignment frame … …

}

expectation_maximization.create_word_translation_prob_dict(parallel_corpus, foreign_name='fr')[source]¶

This will create a dictionary mapping each french word to corresponding english word for keeping their probability. USAGE:

INPUT:
parallel_corpus : the parallel corpus extracted from the
json file.
OUTPUT:
vocab_trans_prob_dict : the vocalbary translation probability
dictionary of form:

{ french_word1 : {english_word1:prob,english_word2:prob,…}, french_word2 : {english_word1:prob,english_word2:prob,…}, … … }

expectation_maximization.expectum_maximum(trans_prob, align_prob, iteration=20)[source]¶

This function will swing the wand and maximize the expectation until convergence.

expectation_maximization.extract_alignment(parallel_corpus, trans_prob, align_prob)[source]¶

This function will extract the alignment for each sentences and return the list of all the alignemnt of each sentences.

expectation_maximization.extract_most_probable_alignment_of_pair(sent_id, sent_pair, trans_prob, align_prob, foreign_name='fr')[source]¶

This function will use the converged values of the alignment and the translation probability to extract the most probable alignment of each sentence.

expectation_maximization.maximize_my_expectation_one_step(trans_prob, align_prob)[source]¶

This function will take the tanslation probability of each word to word translation along with the positional alignment probability and them run one step of expectation maximization by estimating the alignment which will in-turn change the translation probabilty.

IBM Model 1 and 2 using nltk¶

comparison_nltk.IBM(target_listOflists_words, source_listOflists_words, flag)[source]¶

This function takes parallel corpus as input and flag variable (1 for IBM Model 1 & 2 for IBM Model 2) and outputs the alignments

comparison_nltk.tokenize(target_corpus, source_corpus)[source]¶

This helper function tokenizes the sentences into words to be used as input for NLTK implementations

Phrase based translation model¶

class PhraseBased.PhraseBased(corpusFilePath)[source]¶

This class contains methods to implement the phrase based translation model.
